pr_title: [FLINK-18030][hive] Hive UDF doesn't accept empty string literal para…

timeline.author: JingsongLi

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure whether that makes sense because currently we don't have a use case to involve a VARCHAR(0).
Even for CHAR, Flink also has some logic to verify the length is > 0. So having this CHAR(0) as UDF parameter type seems a little inconsistent in the first place.
replies.author: lirui-apache

replies.bodyText:
No, you can not have this assumption.
Maybe there is a VarChar with zero precision in somewhere.
replies.author: JingsongLi
